comment: Example provides representation of an instantiation of E. Hovy's Event Complex schema layout for a disease outbreak.
Please note that in Phase 2b, TA2 performers are expected to output a single complex event, not an event complex of several complex events with different protagonist viewpoints.

instances.name: Legionnaire's Disease outbreak
instances.description: Instantiation of 'Disease Outbreak' schema with Legionella pathogen

events.name: Disease Outbreak
events.description: Legionnaire's Disease outbreak

events.name: Pathogen progression
events.description: Schema for the progression of a pathogen

participants.comment: Role names are not validated.  You can use roles from the KOWG, the DWD overlay, or UMR non-lexical roles
participants can optionally take a wd_node (typically populated by TA1) to clarify the role of the argument in the event.
participants.wd_description: surrounding of an organism or population

relations.comment: Note that relation triples (with wd_nodes taken from DWD relations) can be defined in any event node.  By convention, they should only define relations between child event nodes and/or the node where the relation is defined. This is a silly yet illustrative example.
relations.name: patient is a member of society
relations.wd_description: subject currently or formerly holds the object position or public office

events.name: Come into being
events.description: Event type in which a pathogen comes into being
events.wd_description: ability of an entity to interact with physical or mental reality
events.comment: If a schema event is not found in the documents or Graph G, then it is a prediction.  TA2 must specify predictionProvenance and confidence in the prediction. If the only reason the event is predicted is that it's in the schema, then specify the event @id as predictionProvenance.

events.name: Replicate
events.description: Event type in which a pathogen replicates
events.wd_description: duplicate of information or an artifact based on an instance of that information or artifact

events.name: Spread
events.description: Schema in which a pathogen propagates/spreads

events.name: Escape
events.description: Event type in which a pathogen escapes from a body or reservoir
events.comment: Union of escape (response to distress) and go (to move from a place to another that is further away)
wd_description: to move from a place to another

events.name: Patient exposed to pathogen
events.description: Event type in which a pathogen infects a patient
events.wd_description: invasion of and multiplication in a host by disease-causing pathogens or organisms, and the reaction of host tissues

temporal.comment: TA1 optionally sets minDuration and maxDuration; TA2 sets duration, confidence, and optional provenance of this object
Temporal variables can be combined into one object if they have the same confidence

participants.comment: If TA2 extracts an argument for the event that isn't in the schema, set entity to kairos:NULL

events.name: The pathogen lived in the patient's body
events.description: Event type in which a pathogen lives in the body of a patient
events.comment: This is clearly a bad mapping, but shows that even leaf nodes (verbs) are not constrained to the KOWG events or event pool.
events.wd_description: matter capable of extracting energy from the environment for replication

events.name: Continue
events.description: Schema in which further spreading or a decrease in the prevalence of a pathogen occurs
events.comment: In the original schema, continue had pathogen-spread as a child, but that causes a cycle.

events.name: Decrease in society
events.description: Event type in which a pathogen decreases in society
events.wd_description: decrease in a quantity

events.name: Patient progression
events.description: Schema for the progression of a patient

events.name: The patient traveled to the location of the contaminant
events.description: Event type in which patient(s) travel to contaminated location/facility
events.wd_description: movement of people between geographical locations

events.name: Contract disease
events.description: Event type in which patient(s) contract(s) disease
events.wd_description: invasion of and multiplication in a host by disease-causing pathogens or organisms, and the reaction of host tissues

events.name: The patient gets sick
events.description: Event type in which patient(s) get(s) sick
events.wd_description: abnormal condition negatively affecting organisms

events.name: Diagnosis
events.description: Event type in which patient(s) get(s) diagnosed
events.wd_description: process to determine or identify a disease or disorder, which would account for a person's symptoms and signs

participants.comment: Multiple fillers must be expressed as multiple values objects.  Each value must have a unique @id.

values.comment: Use confidence to represent uncertainty about fillers, with distinct provenance.

events.name: Treatment
events.description: Event type in which patient(s) is/are treated
events.wd_description: attempted medical remediation of a health problem, usually following a diagnosis

events.name: Compliance
events.description: Event type in which life pattern changes
events.comment: Multiple wd_nodes should be specified as lists, not as "wd:Q1399332 | wd:Q67004728"
wd_description: extent to which the patient follows prescribed treatment responsibly, in the broader sense including both medication and appointments

events.name: Patients get medication
events.description: Event type in which patient(s) receive(s) vaccine or other medication
events.comment: vaccination (inoculation) is different from treatment with medications
events.wd_description: administration of a vaccine to protect against disease

values.comment: If there are two source justifications, include them (and their confidences) in a list.  If LDC looks at provenance, it may only consider the first.

events.name: Continue
events.description: Schema for the continuation of an illness in patient(s), improvement or death
events.comment: TA2 could have removed patient-continue (00018) and made patient-die (00019) a sibling and outlink of patient-get-meds (00017).

events.name: The patient dies
events.description: Mr. Ray Brennan died at his home three days after the convention ended of an apparent heart attack.
events.wd_description: permanent cessation of vital functions

events.name: Epidemiologist response
events.description: Schema in which an epidemiologist responds to an outbreak
events.comment: Events/00031/epidemiologist-publish is a source-only event that TA2 placed in the hierarchy.

events.name: Learn
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists learn about a disease
events.wd_description: act of detecting something new

events.name: Investigate
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists investigate clusters
events.comment: Multiple occurrences of repeatable events need to be expanded by TA2 as distinct events in the instantiation, but the repeatable keyword should remain whether or not the event is instantiated.
events.wd_description: project of one or more scientists or an institute or a scientific society

events.name: Announce
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists announce outbreak
events.wd_description: statement made for a public audience

events.name: Research
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists investigate the origins and propagation of a disease
events.wd_description: research involving fundamental scientific principles that may apply to a preclinical understanding – to clinical research, which involves studies of people who may be subjects in clinical trials

events.name: Research
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists research vaccines and other antidotes for a disease
events.comment: WD does not distinguish investigation of the origin from vaccine or treatment research
events.wd_description: research involving fundamental scientific principles that may apply to a preclinical understanding – to clinical research, which involves studies of people who may be subjects in clinical trials

events.name: Educate
events.description: Schema in which epidemiologists carry out their educational mission
events.wd_description: transmission of knowledge and skills

participants.comment: Just like in Phase I, multiple participants can share the same role.

events.name: Educate
events.description: Event types in which epidemiologists educate healthcare workers
events.wd_description: transmission of knowledge and skills

events.name: Educate
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists educate pharmaceutical manufacturers
events.wd_description: transmission of knowledge and skills

events.name: Educate
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists educate government authorities
events.wd_description: transmission of knowledge and skills

events.comment: TA2 can add source-only events (found in the documents but not in the schema); "use none" for ta1ref.
events.name: Publish results
events.description: Epidemiologists publish research results
events.ta2wd_description: statement made for a public audience

participants.comment: entity keyword for source-only events can be kairos:NULL, since there is no TA1 entity.

events.name: Health worker response
events.description: Schema for the response of a health worker to a health crisis
events.wd_description: foobar

entities.name: Pathogen
entities.wd_description: biological entity that causes disease in its host, which is typically an infectious microorganism or agent, such as a virus, bacterium, protozoan, prion, viroid, or fungus

entities.comment: TA2 adds name (human-readable handle from extraction) and extracted type/instance wd_node.
entities.name: Legionella pneumophila
Society
entities.wd_description: group of people related to each other through persistent relations

entities.name: Patient
entities.wd_description: person who takes a medical treatment or is subject of a case study

entities.name: Ray Brennan
entities.comment: Additional wd_nodes/labels just show that a given person can be the patient from one schema and the attacker in another.
ta2wd_description: person who takes a medical treatment or is subject of a case study

entities.name: Joe Smith
entities.ta2wd_description: person who takes a medical treatment or is subject of a case study

entities.comment: This just shows how a specific dosage mentioned in the text can be its own real-world entity.
entities.name: 200 mg Advil
Patient
entities.wd_description: person who takes a medical treatment or is subject of a case study

entities.name: Medical Professional
entities.wd_description: individual who provides medical treatments and health advice

entities.name: Pathogen
entities.wd_description: biological entity that causes disease in its host, which is typically an infectious microorganism or agent, such as a virus, bacterium, protozoan, prion, viroid, or fungus

entities.name: Medication
entities.wd_description: substance used to diagnose, cure, treat, or prevent disease

entities.name: Epidemiologist
entities.wd_description: researcher on how diseases are spread

entities.name: Cluster
entities.wd_description: collection of entities that are physically or conceptually close to each other

entities.name: Pathogen
entities.wd_description: biological entity that causes disease in its host, which is typically an infectious microorganism or agent, such as a virus, bacterium, protozoan, prion, viroid, or fungus

entities.name: Antidote
entities.wd_description: substance that can counteract a form of poisoning

entities.name: Healthcare Sector
entities.wd_description: prevention of disease and promotion of wellbeing

entities.name: Pharmaceutical Manufacturers
entities.wd_description: develops, produces, and markets drugs or pharmaceuticals licensed for use as medications

entities.name: Government Authority
entities.wd_description: organization administrated by a government authority or agency

entities.name: Research Findings
entities.ta2wd_description: all outcomes of a research project

entities.name: Contaminant Location
entities.wd_description: point or an area on something's surface or elsewhere

entities.name: Philadelphia, PA
entities.ta2wd_description: largest city in Pennsylvania, United States

entities.comment: In those rare cases an extracted entity has its own Wikidata entry, it should be used.
entities.name: Pennsylvania Department of Health

comment: This is a TA1 relation that was not found in the documents.  Don't specify confidence or provenance.
It doesn't really make sense to instantiate these equivalence relations, as it will be borne out by instantiated entities.
relations.name: pathogen from pathogen-progression schema has an equivalence relation to the pathogen in the patient-progression schema
relations.wd_description: closeness in value, meaning or effect; relation in which difference can be neglected for practical purposes

relations.name: pathogen from pathogen-progression schema has an equivalence relation to the pathogen in the epidemiologist response schema
relations.wd_description: closeness in value, meaning or effect; relation in which difference can be neglected for practical purposes

relations.comment: This is a TA1 relation that was not found in the documents.  Don't specify confidence or provenance.
relations.name: patient from pathogen-progression schema has an equivalence relation to the patient in the patient-progression schema
relations.wd_description: closeness in value, meaning or effect; relation in which difference can be neglected for practical purposes

relations.comment: relation names (labels) are helpful to human assessors, but are not required at this point.
relations.wd_description: closeness in value, meaning or effect; relation in which difference can be neglected for practical purposes

relations.name: 'Live in body' event from the pathogen-progression schema has an equivalence relation to the 'Patient gets sick' event from the patient-progression schema
relations.wd_description: closeness in value, meaning or effect; relation in which difference can be neglected for practical purposes

relations.comment: TA2 can add source-only relations (found in the documents but not in the schema); use "none" for ta1ref. P551 is 'residence'.
relations.name: Patient resided in location of contaminant.
relations.wd_description: the place where the person is or has been, resident

instances.name: Disease outbreak (variant)
instances.comment: Not all of these schemas are implemented here. Note that 5-digit integers in IDs are independent of other instance.

comment: *Text documents*
'childID' is an LDC child_id. It is the ID of the document/artifact
'parentIDs' is a list of documents that are parent to 'childID.
mediaType is an IANA Media Type.
'offset' and 'length' are in characters.
*Images*
'parentIDs' is a list of documents that are parent to 'childID.
'parentIDs' can be a list because a single image/video/etc. can be embedded in more than one parent document.
'parentIDs' is redundant since the same information is present in the LDC-provided parent_children.tab.
'boundingBox' dimensions are in pixels
*Videos -- key frames*
'startTime' and 'endTime are in seconds.
'keyframes' is an optional array of key frame IDs, but startTime and endTime are still required.
*Audio recordings*
'startTime' and 'endTime are in seconds.
*Videos -- time range*
'startTime' and 'endTime are in seconds.
